meanings.definition: To make something subject to government control or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The new law governmentalizing the internet aims to protect users' privacy.
meanings.sent2: The government is governmentalizing the healthcare system to ensure quality services for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The idea of governmentalizing candy sales might lead to healthier snack options.
meanings.sent4: She felt like governmentalizing her messy room to bring order to the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The process of governmentalizing public transportation improved its efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing something under the authority of a government.
meanings.sent1: The governmentalizing of the company led to stricter regulations and oversight.
meanings.sent2: After the governmentalizing of the land, new rules were put in place for its use.
meanings.sent3: The governmentalizing of the park meant more maintenance but also better facilities.
meanings.sent4: The governmentalizing of the school brought changes that benefited the students.
meanings.sent5: The governmentalizing of the industry brought stability but also increased bureaucracy.
